ygData.subject: my last post for tonight
ygData.msgSnippet: Lunarpine s optics came back online first, he could see the setting sun and the rising moon, he could feel his systems slowly coming back online, he could hear

Lunarpine's optics came back online first, he could see the setting sun and
the rising moon, he could feel his systems slowly coming back online, he
could hear static in his ears and through his comm, his internal repair
system was working it's magic, slowly he was regaining power.

He tried to pull himself to his feat, big mistake, his left arm collapsed
beneath him. pain receptors were deffinately online. He used his right arm
to get back on his feat, it was only a matter of time before the pred
realized it was duped and returned. He had to move himself, at least until
repairs were complete to his comm. He started walking, he just hoped it was
the right direction.


----- Original Message -----
From: <cyberwolf4@...>
To: <nbwrpg@egroups.com>
Sent: Wednesday, August 02, 2000 4:43 AM
Subject: Re: my last post for tonight


> Lunarpine awoke seated next to the stasis pod. he was week, but still
> functioning. "Computer report." There was no answer. his power levels
> were so low that his internal computer had shut itself off. He was in
> bad shape.
>
> A whineing sound came from the pod, DNA scan complete, no compatable
> lifeforms. Protoform not systemized for replication.
>
> "Of course it's not, it's splattered all over the ground." Lunarpine
> was tired of hearing the pods scanner so he raised his hand and
> slapped the control.
>
> Malfunction
>
> BOOM
>
> The control panel exploded sending him about 30 feet through the air,
> crashing through the tall grass to the hard ground below. Lunarpines
> sensors flashed dark and he passed out.
>
> --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, logomorph@h... wrote:
> > OOC:( the sabertooth tiger attacked the pod and knocked it over.
> > That would have caused more damage to the pod. Just keep that in
> mind)
> >
> >
> > --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, cyberwolf4@p... wrote:
> > > Lunarpine found his way back to the stasis pod. he fumbled around
> > > returning the circuitry he'd removed until he got a slight power
> > > reading. The wolfbot hooked himself up hopeing that the pod had
> > > enough energy to sustain him. He hoped that the pod would emit a
> > > strong enough reading to attract Maximals. He hoped that they'd
> > pick
> > > up the signal before the Preds.
>
>
> 
>
>
